result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Corrado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan.
Court will allow expungement after Defendant serves sentence and pays the fine/surcharges/costs in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Corrado

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue - no such number - unable to forward - return to sender

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Corrado
Current: 9460 Chase Street, Milwaukee, WI 53207 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2016)
Prior: 984 Forest Lake Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Renc addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses parties. 

BY THE COURT:
15CT-105:
OWI 2nd offense
Jail sentence for 28 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Last half of the sentence may be served on home monitor if Defendant qualifies and is appropriate for the program
Jail sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County if it can be arranged between the counties
Pay a fine and costs totaling $1,568.00 
Drivers License Revoked 16 Months
IID 16 Months
DOT Assessment for use alcohol and drugs and comply with safety plan (Portage County)
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

15CM-30:
Jail sentence for 5 Days, concurrent to 15CT-105
Pay a fine of $25 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Court will allow expungement after Defendant serves sentence and pays the fine in full

Defendant Anthony J Corrado in court with attorney Anne Renc and attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-30 and 15CT-105.

8:43 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court welcomes all in the jury panel and reviews the rules to the panel.

8:44 AM Clerk administers Voir Dire Oath to the jury panel.
8:45 AM Clerk draws 18 potential jurors.

8:46 AM Voir Dire by the Court.
Juror #2135 addresses the Court, shows a medical letter. Letter is given to both counsel for review. Court will keep letter for the file.
Juror #2135 is excused and replaced by Juror #2108.
Juror #2138 is addressed by the Court regarding language.
Juror #2138 is excused and replaced by Juror #2169.

9:09 AM Voir Dire by Atty Cousins.

9:20 AM Voir Dire by Atty Renc.
9:25 AM Voir Dire by the Court.

9:26 AM Parties exercise their strikes at this time while the Court gives a broad overview to the potential jurors.
Jurors Selected to try this case at this time are:
Juror #2045 R.P.
Juror #2054 K.F.
Juror #2061 A. D.
Juror #2070 P.B.
Juror #2072 M.S.
Juror #2091 M.B.
Juror #2108 D.S.
Juror #2120 P.C.
Juror #2156 J.W.
Juror #2172 C.K.
Juror #2181 D.H.
Juror #2183 A.C.

Court thanks and excuses all potential jurors that were not selected to try this case.

9:33 AM Clerk administers Jurors Oath to the 12 Jurors.

9:35 AM Jury has left the Courtroom.
Parties state that this panel is satisfactory.

Court has received a motion in limine. Court has had a brief discussion with the parties in chambers.  
State is withdrawing the first motion in limine, motion regarding military status of Defendant.  Second item is the State is requesting evidence be admitted regarding evidentary blood draw.

Atty Renc has no objection.

BY THE COURT:
Court will grant the motion.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding motion, where Defendant refused preliminary breath test, cites cases for the record.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, believes the State is correct.

State will be allowed to introduce evidence that the Defendant refused to take the PBT.

Court addresses jury instructions.

9:38 AM Court is in recess until 9:50 AM.

9:52 AM Court is back on the record.
Appearances are as they were before the recess was taken other than the Jury not present.

Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding how the case will be handled between the two attorneys.

9:54 AM Jurors enter the Courtroom.

9:55 AM Court addresses the Jury regarding note taking and opening statements.

9:58 AM Atty Cousins gives opening statements.

10:09 AM Atty Halverson gives opening statements.

10:14 AM Bailff hands out notepads and pencils to the Jury.

10:15 AM Robert Kussow is called and sworn in, police officer with the City of Stevens Point.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
10:22 AM Cross-examination by Atty Renc.
10:24 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
10:25 AM Re-cross by Atty Renc.

10:25 AM Witness is excused form subpoena.

10:26 AM Kevin Sorenson is called and sworn in, Patrol Sgt with Portage Co Sheriff's Office.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies Defendant.
11:05 AM Cross-examination by Atty Halverson.
11:25 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
11:28 AM Re-cross by Atty Halverson.

11:29 AM State rests.

Court will take a 10 minute recess.

State has rested.
Atty Renc may call a witness but makes a motion to dismiss count 2 from the complaint, there was no evidence introduced that would meet the elements of resisting an officer, for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, disagrees with what was testified to, requests motion to be denied.
Court questions Atty Cousins regarding Defendant using force against the officer personally or threatenedly.  
Atty Cousins replies.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds that there is some evidence that the jury could reasonably find that Defendant resisted officer. Court denies Defendant's motion.

Atty Renc intends to call Anthony Corrado.

Court questions Mr. Corrado regarding testifying or not testifying in this case.
Mr. Corrado intends to testify. Atty Renc will handle the testimony. Court questions Atty Renc.
Court is satisfied that Defendant is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily going to testify.

Parties are to return in 5 minutes sharp.

11:42 AM Court is back on the record. Court calls cases. Parties are as they were before the recess.
Parties have nothing to address at this time.

11:43 AM Jurors return to the Courtroom.
All 12 jurors have returned to the Courtroom.

11:44 AM Anthony Corrado is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Renc.
11:55 AM Cross-examination by Atty Cousins.

12:01 PM Witness may step down.

Defense rests.

Atty Cousins may re-call a witness.
Atty Cousins takes a moment to discuss  with Sgt Sorenson.

12:02 PM Kevin Sorenson is re-called to the stand, is reminded that he is still under oath.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
12:05 PM Cross-examination by Atty Renc.

12:06 PM Witness may step down.

State has no further rebuttle witnesses.
Atty Renc will not be calling rebuttle witnesses.

Court addresses the Jurors.  
Court will have a conference scheduling on the jury instructions with the parties.

12:07 PM Court will recess for lunch. Court cautions Jurors to not discuss the case with anyone, even themselves. 
Court advises Jurors to return at 1:45 PM.

12:09 PM Jury has left the Courtroom.
Parties have nothing to state for the record.
Court has provided the parties a copy of the jury instructions. 
Parties are to review the instructions and be prepared for the jury instruction conference at 1:30 PM.

12:10 PM Court is in recess.

**Court Reporter is now M Heaverlo**

1:30 PM Court calls cases.
Court is back on the record.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

The Court has set this time for the jury instruction conference. During the noon hour, the Bailiff was giving a note by one of the jurors. Court reads the note. Court addresses the answer. It begs to question, did the Jurors discuss this case prior to being instructed by the Court according to law.  Any discussion prior to this point would be improper.

State has no comment.
Atty Renc requests a moment to address the matter, wants to look up something.

Parties will continue to review the jury instructions. State has had an opportunity to review the proposed jury instructions, as well as Defense.
State has no objections to state at this time, neither does Defense.

Court has proposed jury instructions as stated on the record. Instructions are addressed at this time.

State has received a copy of the verdict forms.
Atty Renc has received a copy of the verdict forms as well.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, wishes to be heard on the jury question issue.  It is great concern that the question was asked and was asked before the Jury was instructed on the law.  Atty Renc makes a motion for mistrial.

Court is inclined to ask the Bailiff to bring the Juror in who wrote the note, to see if there was discussion.

Juror #2172 is brought in, to question about the note.
Juror #2172 addresses the Court. 
Court questions Juror #2172 for clarifications. 
Atty Cousins questions Juror #2172. 
Atty Renc questions Juror #2172.
Atty Cousins questions further for clarifications.

1:46 PM Juror #2172 is escorted back to Jury Room.

Atty Renc moves for mistrial at this time for reasons stated on the record. Integrity of the jury has been compromised.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court does not find this a deliberation, does not compromises the integrity of jury process, no improper deliberation.
Court will address the question and disregard any comments.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, renews request to dismiss Count 2 for reasons stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not change prior ruling based on totality of circumstances. 
Motion is denied.

Parties have nothing further.

1:52 PM Jurors enter the Courtroom.
All 12 jurors have returned to the Courtroom.

Court addresses the Court, comments about the note as previously stated. Evidentary portion of trial is concluded. Court has some concerns that the question came up and there was discussion among the jurors, if that was the case, then disregard all comments.

Court instructs Jurors on the principle of law, as stated on the record.

2:09 PM Atty Cousins gives closing arguments.

2:32 PM Court sees attorneys at side bar.

Court refers to a drafting error, for the record.

2:34 PM Atty Renc gives closing arguments.

2:42 PM Atty Cousins give rebuttle closing arguments.

2:48 PM Court addresses the Jurors. Court reads the four verdict forms.

2:53 PM Clerk administers Oath of Officers to the Bailiffs.

Jurors retire to the Jury Room to begin deliberations.

2:54 PM Jury has left the Courtroom. Court will make correction on jury instruction.
Parties are to stay close by in case there is a question or a verdict.

3:33 PM Court is back in session.
Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.
Atty Halverson will not be present.
Jury does have a verdict.
Neither party has anything to put on the record.

3:35 PM Jurors enter the Courtroom.
All 12 jurors have returned to the Courtroom.

Members of the jury have arrived at a verdict.
Foreperson provides the verdict forms to the Bailiff.
Bailiff hands the verdict forms to the Court.

Parties are risen.
Court reads verdicts.

Jury finds Defendant GUILTY of OWI 
Jury finds Defendant GUILTY of RESISTING AN OFFICER

Parties are seated.

Atty Renc requests Jury to be polled individually.

Court asks each Juror.

Court addresses Jurors, matter is concluded for the Jurors. 
Court thanks Jurors for their service and are free to go.

3:39 PM Jurors have left the Courtroom.
State moves the Court to find entry of judgment.
Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding Count 2.

Court grants judgment on the verdict.

Court addresses parties regarding Count 2.

Parties are prepared to go to sentencing at this time.
for Joinder of 15CM30 & 15CT105 for purpose of jury trial. /s/TBE 06-12-15

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Corrado
Current: 984 Forest Lake Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2015)
Prior: 1624 S Sierra Highland Dr, Plainfield, IL 60644
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Corrado in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DA #15PT102
ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Renc appears today.
ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of OWI, Resist/Obstruct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond with stated conditions:  
Atty Renc requests a signature bond.
BTC: $1,500 sig bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License and be absolutely sober.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  02-09-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

$1,500 sig bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License and be absolutely sober.
